Params: Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory748.jpg
Noctis
For ****'s sake...
Noctis is about to throw a punch on the bar counter—but decides against it with a quick glance at his surroundings.
All property damage will be billed accordingly.
Noctis
Just how are you even keeping your head so cool...
Well, here's some ice water to get you started.
Noctis sits on the bar counter and stares at the wine glass, still clenching his teeth in burning rage.
I might not seem like it... but I'm damn mad, too.
Daemon might have been one lousy human being, but that doesn't give anyone the right to just take his life without a proper trial.
But rage aside, I really want to know what Daemon and his people are up to coming to this town...
With his face growing soft and fingers laced, Noctis begins recounting Daemon's last words.
Noctis
The guy said they'd be "spearheading" an attack on the town with some Hetero-Creatures...
Meaning that Daemon and his people aren't operating alone.
Noctis
Makes sense! Who sent them here to spearhead the attack, though? That's the million-dollar question here.
I'm guessing it's this "Generalissimo" he was talking about...
Noctis
I'm having trouble seeing where this "Generalissimo" fits in the picture... since Daemon said he belonged to the Forsaken...
Beats me. For all we know, this "Generalissimo" might very well be Nigel.
Unable to reach Babylonia, you have no idea what's happened to the Forsaken or Watanabe...
Noctis
Sucks the guy got smoked before we made him spill more beans, though...
What was the poison, though?
Noctis
Probably some sort of magnetic substance? That's something Nigel would inject into his targets with his weapons.
Noctis

Once it's inside the target's body, he can cause a cardiac arrest with it if the target is a human, or paralyze the target's M.I.N.D. if they're a Construct, which kills them eventually... and that's how he manages to smoke his targets even if the attack itself isn't fatal.
Sounds like one hell of a man...
Noctis
His M.I.N.D. was damaged from modification and that caused him to go blind for good... but that doesn't seem to get in his way at all.
And that's an admirable gift that has turned formidable now that he is no longer a friend.
Noctis
But what Daemon said is a little weird if you think about it... I mean, how are they able to control Hetero-Creatures?
Did anything catch your eye when you fought them?
Noctis
Well, one thing did strike me as weird... The elephant-like Hetero-Creatures that I fought were pretty docile and weren't super combative. They were super particular about their food, though.

There was this one time when you came across Hetero-Creatures in the forest of a Hetero Zone whose ecology was complicated, and unlike anything you'd seen before... and ecology like that is perhaps susceptible to exploitation.
I guess I'd describe them as being "led" rather than "controlled."
Noctis
Like what I did with them using wheat, right?
And if that's the case, then all you need to do to keep the town safe from an attack now is to either drive the Hetero-Creatures away or bait them into leaving before they get here.
If done right, you'll be able to hold the Hetero-Creatures at bay without Babylonia's help.
Noctis
We just gotta figure out where they keep those Hetero-Creatures hidden now...
Remember those hooligans that...
Noctis

Hey, stop judging a book by its cover. I know that's probably what the kids seem like, but they've never done anything morally condemnable, and wreaking havoc on the town is simply out of the question...
Hey, who says I'm talking about those followers of yours?!
Noctis
Oh, you mean those underlings that hang around Daemon?
Daemon's hooligans hang around a deserted brewery nearby town, according to one of Noctis' followers.
And all the food they bought before the Harvest Festival... is probably what they're using to lead the Hetero-Creatures.
There is a good chance that they're operating out of the brewery.
Noctis
Well, we know where they are now, so I say we go and bust them!
Looking ready to get the show on the road, Noctis hops off the chair.
I think we should probably try getting in touch with the mayor before...
Noctis
I just tried that... and wasn't able to reach out to him or that snobby son of his.
You're surprised that Noctis tried to reach out to people instead of jumping the gun.
Noctis
What are you laughing at?
I just find you kind of reliable now.
Noctis
You don't say... but I guess I've grown used to how No. 21 and Vera roll now after spending all this time working with them.
Noctis
But there is just me now... and you, of course, partner, and I can't help but want to ask... do you think we can really pull this off?
No doubt about that at all. I mean, since we're part of this town now.
Noctis
Well, guess I'll pay the brewery a visit on my own, then. They'll have a harder time spotting me that way.
But I want you to promise me this.
Noctis
Uhm? Promise you what...
Since you're just there to stop them from attacking the town...
I want you to promise me that you'll avoid confronting them head-on while you're there.
Noctis
Right... of course.
And that's if Nigel shows up, too, of course...
Noctis
Alright, fine, totally got it. I promise you I'm not going to lay a finger on them even if Nigel shows up...
Noctis' fingers pop a few times as he puts his clenched hand up against his chest. You can tell that he's trying his best not to lose his cool.
(Extend your hand out to bump Noctis' fist.)
I have every faith in you.
Noctis looks taken aback but quickly nods as he pushes your hand back ever so lightly with his fist. A smile blooms across his face.
Noctis
I got this, partner!
And there is just one more thing...
Noctis
What is it?
You run your eye over Noctis, but he doesn't seem to pick up the hint.
Say, don't you think this coating can use some toning down...?
